en: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? Or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
hmr: “Râwla sakêl chun ieng hun laiin am tê a nei ti i hriet am? Sazuk chun tê a nei lai în chik thei am?

en: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? Or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
hmr: Thla iengzât am an pai ti i tiem thei am? Annawleh, ieng hun laiin am tê an nei ti i hriet am?

en: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young, They cast out their pains.
hmr: Anni chu an bawk a, an tê chu an hung nei a, An lungngainahai chu an pei suok tah a.

en: Their young ones become strong, they grow up in the open field; They go forth, and return not again.
hmr: An têhai chu ditumtakin an um a, phûl âwla chun an hung inṭhang lien tah a, An fe suok a, an puihai kuomah an hung kîr nâwk ta nawh a.

en: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? Or who hath loosed the bonds of the swift ass,
hmr: Ram sabengtung chu tuin am zalênin ân suoktir a? Annawleh, ram sabengtung thlungna hruihai chu tuin am a sût a?

en: Whose home I have made the wilderness, And the salt land his dwelling-place?
hmr: Chu in ding chun thlalêr ka siem a, A umna dingin chi ram leh.

en: He scorneth the tumult of the city, Neither heareth he the shoutings of the driver.
hmr: Khawpui risie chu a hmusit a, Khaltuhai khêk rihai chu a hriet ngai bawk nawh.

en: The range of the mountains is his pasture, And he searcheth after every green thing.
hmr: Tlâng dunghai chu a bu petna hmun a na, Thil hring taphawt chu a zawng hlak.

en: Will the wild-ox be content to serve thee? Or will he abide by thy crib?
hmr: “Ramsiel chu nangma rawng bâwl dingin a lungawi ding am a nih? Annawleh, i ran ina chun a chêng ding am a nih?

en: Canst thou bind the wild-ox with his band in the furrow? Or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
hmr: Ramsiel chu a khitna hrui chun ruoma chun i thlung thei ding am a nih? Annawleh, nanga hnunga chun ruomhai chu a chawkruol ding am a nih?

en: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? Or wilt thou leave to him thy labor?
hmr: A hrâtna chu a nasa leiin, ama chu i ring ding maw? Annawleh, ama kuoma chun i sininrimna chu în nghat ding am a nih?

en: Wilt thou confide in him, that he will bring home thy seed, And gather the grain of thy threshing-floor?
hmr: I chihai chu inah ama chun hung lâng a ta, I hrizâwl bu chu ama chun hung la khâwm a tih tiin ama chu i ring ngam chie am a nih?

en: The wings of the ostrich wave proudly; But are they the pinions and plumage of love?
hmr: Ostrik thlahai chu chapotakin an khâwng a, Nisienlakhawm, hmangaina thla le hmulhai an ni am a nih?

en: For she leaveth her eggs on the earth, And warmeth them in the dust,
hmr: A tuihai chu hnuoia chun a mâksan a, Pilvuta chun a suklum sih a.

en: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, Or that the wild beast may trample them.
hmr: Kein sir kawi rawi a tih ti amanih, Annawleh, ramsa chun sir rawi a tih ti chu a ngaituo nawh.

en: She dealeth hardly with her young ones, as if they were not hers: Though her labor be in vain, she is without fear;
hmr: A têhai chunga chun a kâwmaw a, ama tê naw ang elin, A sininrimna chu a thlâwn el a ni ding chu a ṭi nawh.

en: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, Neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
hmr: Pathien chun ama chu varna chu theinghil dinga siemin, A kuoma chun hrietthiemna a lo pêk bawk naw leiin.

en: What time she lifteth up herself on high, She scorneth the horse and his rider.
hmr: Chungtienga ama chu ân lêng sâng pha chun, Sakawr le a chunga chuong chu a hmusit a.

en: Hast thou given the horse his might? Hast thou clothed his neck with the quivering mane?
hmr: “Sakawr chu a hrâtna nangin i pêk am a nih? A rîng chu thahrui chun în thuom bawk am a nih?

en: Hast thou made him to leap as a locust? The glory of his snorting is terrible.
hmr: Ama chu khâuṭhikṭhi anga inchâwm thei dingin i siem am a nih? A hnârkhâwng dut dut ṭiumzie dâm hi?

en: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: He goeth out to meet the armed men.
hmr: Ruoma chun ân châwm a, a hrâtnaa chun a hlim a, Mi inrâlthuomhai chu tuok dingin a fe suok a.

en: He mocketh at fear, and is not dismayed; Neither turneth he back from the sword.
hmr: Ṭitna chu a nuisan a, a beidawng nawh a, Kâwlhnâma inthawk khawma a tlânse ngai bawk nawh.

en: The quiver rattleth against him, The flashing spear and the javelin.
hmr: A chunga chun thalbâwm chu ân ri thuok thuok a, Fei le thal tle zawk zawk hai le chun.

en: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage; Neither believeth he that it is the voice of the trumpet.
hmr: Lunginsenna le ṭitnain hnuoi chu a lem a, Tawtawrâwt riah a ngir ṭawkṭawk thei nawh a.

en: As oft as the trumpet soundeth he saith, Aha! And he smelleth the battle afar off, The thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
hmr: Tawtawrâwt chu ân ri po leh, ‘Aha,’ a ta, Hlataka inthawkin indona chu a rim a hriet a, Sipai hotuhai khêkri le an êngri chu.

en: Is it by thy wisdom that the hawk soareth, And stretcheth her wings toward the south?
hmr: “Mu hi nanga varnain a birin, A thlahai chu simtieng a phar am a nih?

en: Is it at thy command that the eagle mounteth up, And maketh her nest on high?
hmr: Muvânlai chu insângtaka inlêng a, Chungtienga a bu siem chu nanga thupêk am a nih?

en: On the cliff she dwelleth, and maketh her home, Upon the point of the cliff, and the stronghold.
hmr: Râwlkhoa chun a um a, chutaka chun riekna chu a nei a; Kul dettak le lungpui kak kâr chunga chun,

en: From thence she spieth out the prey; Her eyes behold it afar off.
hmr: Chutaka inthawk chun a safâk ding chu a hmuh a, A mithai chun hlataka inthawk chun a en a.

en: Her young ones also suck up blood: And where the slain are, there is she.
hmr: A têhai khawmin thisen an dâwn a, Inthatna umna hmuna chun, chutaka chun a um a nih,” tiin.
